programme.title: The Johnny Carson Show
programme.sub-title: Comic Legends Of The '80s - Charles Grodin (12/9/83)
programme.desc: Frequent guest Charles Grodin discusses his movie The Lonely Guy, which also stars Steve Martin.

programme.title: The Johnny Carson Show
programme.sub-title: Hollywood Icons Of The '90s - Craig T. Nelson (4/2/92)
programme.desc: Actor Craig T. Nelson recalls his first (disastrous) appearance on The Tonight Show.

programme.title: The Johnny Carson Show
programme.sub-title: Comic Legends Of The '60s - Carl Reiner (1/4/83)
programme.desc: Carl improvises Italian aria and riffs on tabloid celebrity stories. Greg Louganis shows off on a trampoline.

programme.title: The Johnny Carson Show
programme.sub-title: Hollywood Icons Of The '70s - Peter Fonda (1/4/85)
programme.desc: Actor/screenwriter Peter Fonda opens up about being compared to his father and sister.

programme.title: The Johnny Carson Show
programme.sub-title: Hollywood Icons Of The '50s - Charlton Heston (4/30/80)
programme.desc: Two-time Oscar winner Charlton Heston describes his world travels and his two Oscars.

programme.title: The Johnny Carson Show
programme.sub-title: Comic Legends Of The '70s - Steve Martin (12/14/88)
programme.desc: Comedian Steve Martin creates mayhem punching Santa backstage then sitting on his lap on Johnnyâ€™s couch.

programme.title: The Johnny Carson Show
programme.sub-title: Hollywood Icons Of The '90s - Kevin Pollak (10/31/90)
programme.desc: Find out why is Kevin Pollak dressed as Cupid when he joins the show?

programme.title: The Johnny Carson Show
programme.sub-title: The Very Best of Johnny and Guests - Charles Grodin, The Amazing Randi (3/22/73)
programme.desc: The Amazing Randi does a stunt involving a ladder. Charles Grodin details a recent harrowing plane flight.

programme.title: The Johnny Carson Show
programme.sub-title: The Very Best of Johnny and Guests - Gunther Gebel-Williams, Sid Caesar, Art Carney, Christopher Plummer (5/18/73)
programme.desc: Gunther Gebel-Williams brings out some circus tigers, Christopher Plummer shares stories from the stage, Art Carney leads Sid Caesar and Johnny in a jazz song.

programme.title: The Johnny Carson Show
programme.sub-title: The Very Best of Johnny and Guests - Wilt Chamberlain, Michael Landon, Johnny Mathis (9/28/73)
programme.desc: Wilt Chamberlain is leaving the Lakers, Michael Landon talks Bonanza, and Johnny Mathis sings "I'm Going Home."

programme.title: The Johnny Carson Show
programme.sub-title: The Very Best of Johnny and Guests - Paul Williams, Freddie Prinze, Bob Uecker (10/16/74)
programme.desc: Paul Williams sings "You and Me Against the World" and "I Won't Last A Day Without You." Freddie Prinze does standup and Bob Uecker broadcast a game from a hot air balloon.

programme.title: The Johnny Carson Show
programme.sub-title: The Very Best of Johnny and Guests - Lucille Ball, The Jackson 5 (11/15/74)
programme.desc: Lucille Ball says she never misses one of Johnny's shows and takes a Cosmopolitan magazine quiz. The Jackson 5 sing two songs and talk about their plans for their time off.

programme.title: The Johnny Carson Show
programme.sub-title: The Very Best of Johnny and Guests - Ann-Margret, Bruce Dern, Art Carney (1/22/75)
programme.desc: Ann-Margret gives Johnny a Swedish lesson then performs a musical number, Bruce Dern shares when he had his first kiss, and Art Carney shows up in his pajamas.

programme.title: The Johnny Carson Show
programme.sub-title: The Very Best of Johnny and Guests - George Peppard, Jill Ireland, Frank Abagnale, Pete Fountain (4/6/78)
programme.desc: Pete Fountain performs with the band. George Peppard wants to be cast as a song and dance man. Jill Ireland is a new horse owner. Noted conman Frank Abagnale appears.

programme.title: The Johnny Carson Show
programme.sub-title: The Very Best of Johnny and Guests - Jimmy Stewart, Don Adams, The Manhattan Transfer (5/14/80)
programme.desc: Carnac the Magnificent stops by. Jimmy Stewart reminisces about his film career. Get Smart's Don Adams has a new movie. The Manhattan Transfer performs.

programme.title: The Johnny Carson Show
programme.sub-title: The Very Best of Johnny and Guests - Ringo Starr, Barbara Bach, The Oak Ridge Boys, Jerry Seinfeld (5/6/81)
programme.desc: Ringo Starr appears with his wife Barbara Bach. Jerry Seinfeld does his first Tonight Show standup. The Oak Ridge Boys perform.

programme.title: The Johnny Carson Show
programme.sub-title: The Very Best of Johnny and Guests - Tim Conway, Willie Nelson (5/18/82)
programme.desc: Tim Conway went to one Hollywood party and his car got stolen. Johnny talks about filming a pet food commercial. Willie Nelson performs 2 songs.

programme.title: The Johnny Carson Show
programme.sub-title: The Very Best of Johnny and Guests - Charles Grodin, The Amazing Randi (3/22/73)
programme.desc: The Amazing Randi does a stunt involving a ladder. Charles Grodin details a recent harrowing plane flight.

programme.desc: Gunther Gebel-Williams brings out some circus tigers, Christopher Plummer shares stories from the stage, Art Carney leads Sid Caesar and Johnny in a jazz song.

programme.sub-title: The Very Best of Johnny and Guests - Wilt Chamberlain, Michael Landon, Johnny Mathis (9/28/73)
programme.desc: Wilt Chamberlain is leaving the Lakers, Michael Landon talks Bonanza, and Johnny Mathis sings "I'm Going Home."

programme.desc: Paul Williams sings "You and Me Against the World" and "I Won't Last A Day Without You." Freddie Prinze does standup and Bob Uecker broadcast a game from a hot air balloon.
